intro: Calochortus tiburonensis, commonly known as Tiburon mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes a variety of flowering plants known for their showy blooms. This species is characterized by its striking, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the coast, thriving in full sun. Calochortus tiburonensis is an important part of the local ecosystem and is often found in coastal dunes and open grasslands.
